about.name: Bali
about.info_text: Bali, often referred to as the 'Island of the Gods,' is a tropical paradise located in Indonesia. It is renowned for its stunning landscapes, lush rice terraces, pristine beaches, and vibrant culture. Bali offers a perfect blend of natural beauty, spiritual experiences, and a wide range of activities. Whether you're looking to relax on beautiful beaches, explore ancient temples, or enjoy water sports, Bali has something for everyone. The island's warm hospitality and unique Balinese traditions make it a must-visit destination for travelers.

attractions_card.title: Uluwatu Temple
attractions_card.description: Uluwatu Temple is a sea temple perched on a clifftop, offering breathtaking sunset views and traditional Kecak dance performances.

attractions_card.title: Ubud Monkey Forest
attractions_card.description: The Ubud Monkey Forest is a sanctuary for long-tailed macaques and a lush jungle area, located in the heart of Ubud.

attractions_card.title: Tegallalang Rice Terraces
attractions_card.description: The Tegallalang Rice Terraces are famous for their intricate and beautiful rice paddies, offering a stunning backdrop for photos and walks.

attractions_card.title: Tanah Lot Temple
attractions_card.description: Tanah Lot Temple is a coastal temple set on a rock formation, providing picturesque sunset views and a glimpse into Balinese spirituality.

attractions_card.title: Kuta Beach
attractions_card.description: Kuta Beach is a popular destination for surfing, sunbathing, and vibrant nightlife, making it one of Bali's most well-known beaches.

attractions_card.title: Water Palace Tirta Gangga
attractions_card.description: Tirta Gangga is a former royal palace with stunning water gardens and fountains, creating a serene and picturesque environment.

attractions_card.title: Mount Batur
attractions_card.description: Mount Batur is an active volcano, and hiking to its summit for sunrise is a popular adventure for trekkers and nature enthusiasts.

attractions_card.title: Bali Safari and Marine Park
attractions_card.description: The Bali Safari and Marine Park offers a chance to get up close with wildlife in a conservation setting, including safaris and animal shows.

food_card.title: Nasi Goreng
food_card.description: Nasi Goreng is a flavorful Indonesian fried rice dish, often served with a fried egg on top and a variety of accompaniments.

food_card.title: Mie Goreng
food_card.description: Mie Goreng is a stir-fried noodle dish with a delicious mix of vegetables, meat, and Indonesian spices.

food_card.title: Nasi Campur
food_card.description: Nasi Campur is a Balinese dish that combines a variety of flavors, featuring a scoop of rice surrounded by small portions of vegetables, peanuts, and meats.

food_card.title: Sate
food_card.description: Sate, or satay, is a popular Indonesian dish consisting of skewered and grilled meat, served with a flavorful peanut sauce.

food_card.title: Balinese Coffee
food_card.description: Balinese coffee is known for its rich flavor and can be enjoyed at local cafes, often accompanied by stunning views.

hotels_card.title: AYANA Resort and Spa Bali
hotels_card.description: AYANA is a luxury resort with a clifftop location in Jimbaran, offering beautiful ocean views and world-class facilities.

hotels_card.alt: Four Seasons Resort Bali at Sayan
hotels_card.title: Four Seasons Resort Bali at Sayan
hotels_card.description: The Four Seasons in Sayan offers a serene rainforest retreat with luxurious villas, river views, and a renowned spa.

hotels_card.title: COMO Uma Ubud
hotels_card.description: COMO Uma Ubud is a boutique hotel in Ubud known for its tranquil setting, wellness programs, and Balinese design.

hotels_card.title: W Bali - Seminyak
hotels_card.description: W Bali is a stylish beachfront resort in Seminyak, offering a vibrant atmosphere, modern design, and beachfront parties.

hotels_card.title: The St. Regis Bali Resort
hotels_card.description: The St. Regis in Nusa Dua is a luxury beachfront resort with refined accommodations, a lagoon, and exquisite dining.

transport_card.title: Ngurah Rai International Airport
transport_card.description: Ngurah Rai International Airport (DPS) is Bali's main international airport, serving domestic and international flights.

transport_card.title: Scooters and Motorbikes
transport_card.description: Scooters and motorbikes are a common mode of transport in Bali, and they can be rented for convenient local travel.

transport_card.title: Bali Bemo
transport_card.description: Bemos are small public minivans used for short journeys in Bali, and they are an affordable way to get around.

transport_card.title: Blue Bird Taxis
transport_card.description: Blue Bird is a reliable and well-known taxi company in Bali, with metered fares for hassle-free rides.
